reviews.review_msg: If you are passionate about research and not caring that much about grades (i.e. you don't expect to get A+ for all courses),this is definitely a great course to take. If you ask questions about research, she will quickly identify the problems and give you advice. She gave detailed feedbacks. She has a very high standard, but grading is not tough.

Professor Chang did a fantastic job covering the fairly broad field of grounded NLP. Her course changed the things and directions I think are important in research, afforded substantial opportunities to become a better researcher, and was overall extremely chill. The amount of work is substantial but easily manageable, and a good use of time.

His lectures are very well-organized with clear outlines and transitions. Extra helpful for having additional offices hours to help each project group on their ideas. You can always ask for things that are not clear and he would answer them patiently all the time. You do learn something useful from his lectures.

Mo is highly intelligent and knowledgeable. He sometimes makes one mistake and that is assuming everyone has the same level of intelligence as him. Therefore, the level of his courses might be to tough for some people at SFU. But he is an amazing and kind person. It was a pleasure for me to get to know and work and take courses with him.
He was a great teacher and also the course was great. It was a hard course, but I learned great knowledges.
